results.title: Winter sleepers = Winterschlafer
results.creator_credit: Tom Tykwer, Stefan Arndt, German Independents, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, Bavaria Film, BMI, Arte, Mitteldeutscher Rundfunk, WDR, Palladio Film, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, Filmstiftung NRW and X filme creative Pool
results.brief_description: Tykwer’s elaborately designed second feature, which preceded his commercially successful ‘Run Lola Run’ (1998), is set in a ski village in a remote province in southern Germany. The plot follows the various threads that connect the confused lives of two couples in their thirties. Theo, a projectionist in the local theatre, steals a car belonging to lovers Rebecca and Marco and takes it for a joyride. He collides with the car of a local farmer gravely injuring his daughter, but due to a short term memory loss, leaves the scene without helping the injured girl or her family. Later he becomes involved with Laura, a nurse, who has been taking care of the girl. Both couples are rootless and without ambition or drive, and Tywker uses the time allowed by his elliptical narrative to compare and contrast the two relationships on display. He deploys stylistic formalism to make connections between what are essentially shallow characters. Their incompatibilities are underpinned by the use of colour-coding, while the repeated use of lap dissolves sets up unexpected connections between them. Cast includes Floriane Daniel, Heino Ferch, Ulrich Matthes, Marie-Lou Sellem and Josef Bierbichler. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: All about my mother = Todo sobre mi madre [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Esther Garcia, France 2 Cinema, Renn Productions and El Deseo S. A.
results.brief_description: Cecilia Roth plays Manuela, a single working mother whose life takes a tragic twist when her son is killed in a road accident after a performance of “A Streetcar Named Desire”. Manuela decides to return to Barcelona and confront her son’s missing father, hoping that by correcting the mistakes in her past she can find some hope of alleviating the anguish and despair of grief. In Barcelona Manuela finds herself integrated into a new family consisting of transvestite prostitute Agrado (Antonia San Juan), a HIV positive Catholic nun (Penelope Cruz), and the great actress Huma Roja (Marisa Paredes) whose performance as Blanche in “Streetcar” was so beloved by Manuela’s son. Almodovar’s earlier films were absurdist comedies about the sexual and cultural values of a Spain emerging from under Franco’s fascist rule. “All About My Mother” retains his comic surrealism, and the characters still inhabit a world where traditional gender and sexual differences are rendered meaningless, but the film is also a homage to great Hollywood melodrama and in particular the great female legends of the stage and screen. Manuela’s escape from grief occurs only when she can reclaim motherhood, but it is an ideal of motherhood and family not rooted in biology but in friendship and the acceptance of difference. This film says the world is harsh, ugly and unfair but that through the bonds humans make with one another it can also be warm, generous and beautiful. This loving tribute to women (in all their aspects) contains splendid cinematography by Affonso Beatto. (Awards: Winner of the Academy Award and Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film. Winner of Best Director Award at the Cannes Film Festival) In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Van
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Lynda Myles, Deadly Films and BBC
results.brief_description: Set during the 1989 World Cup season when Ireland’s national identity is intricately wrapped up in its sporting success, “The Van” follows the relationship of lifelong friends, Brendan (Bimbo) and Larry. Larry, long time unemployed and living on welfare, finds his professional friend Bimbo joining the ranks of the unemployed when he is retrenched. With the help of a dodgy associate, Bimbo purchases a dilapidated van and miraculously cleans it up to create the modest business enterprise of Bimbo’s Burgers. He asks his best mate Larry to work for him, and soon Larry’s daughter Diane and vegetarian son Kevin begin work with them to cater for the soccer, beach and concert crowds. As the pressure of working long hours, meeting stringent health regulations and Bimbo’s dismay at Larry’s work ethic weighs on them, Larry and Bimbo push the boundaries of their relationship, forcing them to choose between being partners and being friends. With a soundtrack by Eric Clapton, “The Van” is the final chapter in Roddy Doyle’s Barrytown trilogy. Cast includes Colm Meaney, Donal O’Kelly, Neili Conroy and Ger Ryan.

results.title: Felicia's journey
results.creator_credit: Atom Egoyan, Bruce Davey, Screenventures, Alliance Atlantis and Marquis Films
results.brief_description: Atom Egoyan’s second literary adaptation (“The Sweet Hereafter” was the first) is a dark yet comic tale of the powerful influence of childhood and the search for contentment in life’s journey. Pregnant and alone, Felicia (Elaine Cassidy) leaves her native home of Ireland in search of Johnny, father of her unborn child. Arriving in Birmingham with few clues as to his location, she meets factory canteen manager Mr Hilditch (Bob Hoskins), a seemingly benevolent gent who offers to help Felicia find lodgings and her love. Hilditchs’ home is a time capsule of 1950’s homewear, and he spends his evenings watching footage of his mother, Gala (Arsinee Khanjian), a successful television chef, and himself as a young child in the background. The relationship revealed throughout the footage is deliciously tinged with antagonism and pain, something that remains with Hilditch throughout his adult life and appears to have influenced his relationship with women. Felicia is not the first wayward soul assisted by Mr Hilditch, as it is revealed he has recorded the innermost thoughts of numerous other women he has picked up in his car - Felicia appears to be the next in line. Cast also includes Peter McDonald, Gerard McSorley and Claire Benedict. Based on the novel by William Trevor.

results.title: Small faces
results.creator_credit: Gillies MacKinnon, Steve Clark-Hall, Billy MacKinnon and Skyline Easterhouse Ltd (Glasgow)
results.brief_description: Set in Glasgow in the late 1960’s, ‘Small faces’ is a gritty depiction of three working class brothers coming of age in an environment of gang warfare. The eldest, wayward Bobby is in the Glens, Alan, the artistic middle son is in love with the girl downstairs, and the youngest son Lex is creating the most cause for concern when he accidentally shoots the leader of the Tongs, mental Malky (Kevin McKidd), in the eye with an air rifle. The actions of Lex draw in Alan, the last of the MacLeans to be involved in the Glen/Tong animosity, setting a momentum they cannot control and forcing the brothers to question their loyalty between family and friends. Their story is set against a strong home environment, one in which their mother is acutely aware of their heritage and a time when things were better, yet also devoid of obvious male role models as Lex is torn between Alan and Bobby, and Bobby turning to the Glens without question. Cast includes Claire Higgins, Iain Robertson, Joseph McFadden and Laura Fraser.

results.title: William Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream
results.creator_credit: Michael Hoffman, Leslie Urdang, Regency Enterprises and Fox Searchlight Pictures
results.brief_description: A stellar cast headed by Michelle Pfeiffer and Kevin Kline, bring Shakespeare’s capering romantic comedy to life. When two pairs of star-crossed lovers, a feuding pair of supernatural sprites (Titania and Oberon), and a love potion gone awry all come together in an enchanted moonlit forest, the result is a delightful mix of merriment and magic. Cast also includes Calista Flockhart, Stanley Tucci and Rupert Everett.

results.title: Shampoo
results.creator_credit: Hal Ashby, Warren Beatty and Vista Company
results.brief_description: A frankly adult comedy about the sex lives of the rich and aimless, “Shampoo” is also a pointed commentary on the demise of the 60s idealism at the dawn of the Nixon era. It is election day, 1968, and Beverly Hills hairdresser George Roundy is too worried about attending to all of his womens’ tonsorial and sexual needs and trying to swing a bank loan to fund his own salon to notice the fateful Presidential race. As George juggles the demands of girlfriend Jill and mistress Felicia, not to mention Felicia’s daughter, he meets Felicia’s husband - Lester, to get money for the salon and discovers that his beloved ex-girlfriend, Jackie is now Lester’s mistress. Lester asks George to escort Jackie to a banquet for Nixon supporters, leading to a series of climactic confrontations at the dinner and a Hollywood orgy that exposes the conflicting demands of sex, love and security among these terminally narcissistic L.A. denizens. Cast includes: Warren Beatty, Julie Christie, Goldie Hawn, Lee Grant, Jack Warden and Carrie Fisher.

results.title: The Long walk of Nelson Mandela
results.creator_credit: Clifford Bestall, Indra de Langerolle, David Fanning, Unapix Entertainment Productions, LLC and Story Street Productions
results.brief_description: This is an intimate portrait of one of the century’s greatest leaders told by those who have known and shared the more important moments of his life. However it is not just a narrative of Mandela’s life, its purpose is to examine how Mandela has risen above his very public personal trials and kept his eye unflinchingly on a distant and noble goal. Mandela’s life story and achievements are told through interviews with his contemporaries and friends and the use of archival footage.

results.title: Life is beautiful = La vita e bella
results.creator_credit: Roberto Benigni, Gianluigi Braschi, Elda Ferri and Melampo Cinematografica
results.brief_description: In this World War II tragicomedy, writer/director Roberto Benigni portrays Guido, who moves during the 30s from the country to a Tuscan town, where he falls in love with schoolteacher Dora. Dora likes Guido, but she remains faithful to her pompous fiancee, causing Guido to come up with inventive ways of wooing her. Meanwhile, anti-semitic attitudes lead to attacks against Jewish members of the community, including Guido’s uncle. Leaping ahead five years, during World War II, Guido and Dora are married with a son Giosue. After they are imprisoned in a concentration camp, Guido goes to elaborate lengths to keep his son from understanding the truth of their situation. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes: Roberto Benigni, Nicoletta Braschi, Giustino Durano and Giorgio Cantarini.

results.title: Onegin [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Martha Fiennes, Simon Bosanquet, Ileen Maisel, Onegin Productions and Baby Productions
results.brief_description: Jaded aristocrat, Evgeny Onegin (Ralph Fiennes), gladly abandons the decadent opulence of St. Petersburg’s high society after unexpectedly inheriting his uncle’s country estate. Despite feeling out of place in such a provincial setting, he manages to form an uneasy friendship with Vladimir Lensky (Toby Stevens), who introduces him to the sister of his fiance, Tatyana Larina (Liv Tyler). Tatyana becomes enamoured with Onegin and, caught up in the frenzy of first love, writes him a passionate letter expressing her feelings. However, she is devastated when Onegin cruelly rejects her and turns his attention to her sister, an action which eventually results in a duel with the enraged Lensky. Returning to St. Petersburg once again, Onegin spirals downward into a deep depression, obsessed with what might have been in this exquisitely filmed version of Alexander Pushkin’s famous novel, “Eugene Onegin”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martha Fiennes, Simon Bosanquet, Ileen Maisel, Onegin Productions and Baby Productions
